SENT.plain: Although the red nucleus often has been suggested to be the lesion site responsible for Claude's syndrome, the precise localization of the syndrome is uncertain
Lesion sites were reviewed in six patients with Claude's syndrome and compared with other patients with the syndrome identified by a literature search
The findings strongly suggest that Claude's syndrome occurs because of a lesion of the superior cerebellar peduncle just below and medial to the red nucleus
Midbrain infarction and partial oculomotor nerve palsy was common
